segments.text: My frustration is starting to build as I watch this unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, blissfully unaware of the absolute mess and danger around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not feel her foot in a growing puddle of water?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s beyond me how someone could be so absorbed in polishing a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children are playing with fire, or rather, with gravity and a cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is going to give way, I can feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy could easily fall and hit his head on the counter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him getting hurt makes my stomach clench.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This entire situation is just an accident waiting to happen, on multiple fronts.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout and make her look around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of unawareness is truly maddening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to intervene before things get really bad.
segments.speaker: PAR
